74static const char *configfile = _PATH_BLCONF;
75static DB *state;
76static const char *dbfile = _PATH_BLSTATE;
77static sig_atomic_t readconf;
78static sig_atomic_t done;
79static int vflag;
80
81static void
82sigusr1(int n __unused)
83{
84 debug++;
85}
86
87static void
88sigusr2(int n __unused)
89{
90 debug--;
91}
92
93static void
94sighup(int n __unused)
95{
96 readconf++;
97}
98
99static void
100sigdone(int n __unused)
101{
102 done++;
103}
104
105static __dead void
106usage(int c)
107{
108 if (c)
109 warnx("Unknown option `%c'", (char)c);
110 fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s [-vdfr] [-c <config>] [-R <rulename>] "
111 "[-P <sockpathsfile>] [-C <controlprog>] [-D <dbfile>] "
112 "[-s <sockpath>] [-t <timeout>]\n", getprogname());
113 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
114}
115
116static int
117getremoteaddress(bl_info_t *bi, struct sockaddr_storage *rss, socklen_t *rsl)
118{
119 *rsl = sizeof(*rss);
120 memset(rss, 0, *rsl);
121
122 if (getpeername(bi->bi_fd, (void *)rss, rsl) != -1)
123 return 0;
124
125 if (errno != ENOTCONN) {
126 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "getpeername failed (%m)");
127 return -1;
128 }
129
130 if (bi->bi_slen == 0) {
131 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "unconnected socket with no peer in message");
132 return -1;
133 }
134
135 switch (bi->bi_ss.ss_family) {
136 case AF_INET:
137 *rsl = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
138 break;
139 case AF_INET6:
140 *rsl = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
141 break;
142 default:
143 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "bad client passed socket family %u",
144 (unsigned)bi->bi_ss.ss_family);
145 return -1;
146 }
147
148 if (*rsl != bi->bi_slen) {
149 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "bad client passed socket length %u != %u",
150 (unsigned)*rsl, (unsigned)bi->bi_slen);
151 return -1;
152 }
153
154 memcpy(rss, &bi->bi_ss, *rsl);
155
156#ifdef HAVE_STRUCT_SOCKADDR_SA_LEN
157 if (*rsl != rss->ss_len) {
158 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR,
159 "bad client passed socket internal length %u != %u",
160 (unsigned)*rsl, (unsigned)rss->ss_len);
161 return -1;
162 }
163#endif
164 return 0;
165}
166
167static void
168process(bl_t bl)
169{
170 struct sockaddr_storage rss;
171 socklen_t rsl;
172 char rbuf[BUFSIZ];
173 bl_info_t *bi;
174 struct conf c;
175 struct dbinfo dbi;
176 struct timespec ts;
177
178 if (clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &ts) == -1) {
179 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "clock_gettime failed (%m)");
180 return;
181 }
182
183 if ((bi = bl_recv(bl)) == NULL) {
184 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "no message (%m)");
185 return;
186 }
187
188 if (getremoteaddress(bi, &rss, &rsl) == -1)
189 goto out;
190
191 if (debug) {
192 sockaddr_snprintf(rbuf, sizeof(rbuf), "%a:%p", (void *)&rss);
193 (*lfun)(LOG_DEBUG, "processing type=%d fd=%d remote=%s msg=%s"
194 " uid=%lu gid=%lu", bi->bi_type, bi->bi_fd, rbuf,
195 bi->bi_msg, (unsigned long)bi->bi_uid,
196 (unsigned long)bi->bi_gid);
197 }
198
199 if (conf_find(bi->bi_fd, bi->bi_uid, &rss, &c) == NULL) {
200 (*lfun)(LOG_DEBUG, "no rule matched");
201 goto out;
202 }
203
204
205 if (state_get(state, &c, &dbi) == -1)
206 goto out;
207
208 if (debug) {
209 char b1[128], b2[128];
210 (*lfun)(LOG_DEBUG, "%s: initial db state for %s: count=%d/%d "
211 "last=%s now=%s", __func__, rbuf, dbi.count, c.c_nfail,
212 fmttime(b1, sizeof(b1), dbi.last),
213 fmttime(b2, sizeof(b2), ts.tv_sec));
214 }
215
216 switch (bi->bi_type) {
217 case BL_ADD:
218 dbi.count++;
219 dbi.last = ts.tv_sec;
220 if (dbi.id[0]) {
221 /*
222 * We should not be getting this since the rule
223 * should have blocked the address. A possible
224 * explanation is that someone removed that rule,
225 * and another would be that we got another attempt
226 * before we added the rule. In anycase, we remove
227 * and re-add the rule because we don't want to add
228 * it twice, because then we'd lose track of it.
229 */
230 (*lfun)(LOG_DEBUG, "rule exists %s", dbi.id);
231 (void)run_change("rem", &c, dbi.id, 0);
232 dbi.id[0] = '\0';
233 }
234 if (c.c_nfail != -1 && dbi.count >= c.c_nfail) {
235 int res = run_change("add", &c, dbi.id, sizeof(dbi.id));
236 if (res == -1)
237 goto out;
238 sockaddr_snprintf(rbuf, sizeof(rbuf), "%a",
239 (void *)&rss);
240 (*lfun)(LOG_INFO,
241 "blocked %s/%d:%d for %d seconds",
242 rbuf, c.c_lmask, c.c_port, c.c_duration);
243
244 }
245 break;
246 case BL_DELETE:
247 if (dbi.last == 0)
248 goto out;
249 dbi.count = 0;
250 dbi.last = 0;
251 break;
252 default:
253 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "unknown message %d", bi->bi_type);
254 }
255 state_put(state, &c, &dbi);
256
257out:
258 close(bi->bi_fd);
259
260 if (debug) {
261 char b1[128], b2[128];
262 (*lfun)(LOG_DEBUG, "%s: final db state for %s: count=%d/%d "
263 "last=%s now=%s", __func__, rbuf, dbi.count, c.c_nfail,
264 fmttime(b1, sizeof(b1), dbi.last),
265 fmttime(b2, sizeof(b2), ts.tv_sec));
266 }
267}
268
269static void
270update_interfaces(void)
271{
272 struct ifaddrs *oifas, *nifas;
273
274 if (getifaddrs(&nifas) == -1)
275 return;
276
277 oifas = ifas;
278 ifas = nifas;
279
280 if (oifas)
281 freeifaddrs(oifas);
282}
283
284static void
285update(void)
286{
287 struct timespec ts;
288 struct conf c;
289 struct dbinfo dbi;
290 unsigned int f, n;
291 char buf[128];
292 void *ss = &c.c_ss;
293
294 if (clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &ts) == -1) {
295 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "clock_gettime failed (%m)");
296 return;
297 }
298
299again:
300 for (n = 0, f = 1; state_iterate(state, &c, &dbi, f) == 1;
301 f = 0, n++)
302 {
303 time_t when = c.c_duration + dbi.last;
304 if (debug > 1) {
305 char b1[64], b2[64];
306 sockaddr_snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%a:%p", ss);
307 (*lfun)(LOG_DEBUG, "%s:[%u] %s count=%d duration=%d "
308 "last=%s " "now=%s", __func__, n, buf, dbi.count,
309 c.c_duration, fmttime(b1, sizeof(b1), dbi.last),
310 fmttime(b2, sizeof(b2), ts.tv_sec));
311 }
312 if (c.c_duration == -1 || when >= ts.tv_sec)
313 continue;
314 if (dbi.id[0]) {
315 run_change("rem", &c, dbi.id, 0);
316 sockaddr_snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%a", ss);
317 syslog(LOG_INFO, "released %s/%d:%d after %d seconds",
318 buf, c.c_lmask, c.c_port, c.c_duration);
319 }
320 state_del(state, &c);
321 goto again;
322 }
323}
324
325static void
326addfd(struct pollfd **pfdp, bl_t **blp, size_t *nfd, size_t *maxfd,
327 const char *path)
328{
329 bl_t bl = bl_create(true, path, vflag ? vdlog : vsyslog);
330 if (bl == NULL || !bl_isconnected(bl))
331 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
332 if (*nfd >= *maxfd) {
333 *maxfd += 10;
334 *blp = realloc(*blp, sizeof(**blp) * *maxfd);
335 if (*blp == NULL)
336 err(EXIT_FAILURE, "malloc");
337 *pfdp = realloc(*pfdp, sizeof(**pfdp) * *maxfd);
338 if (*pfdp == NULL)
339 err(EXIT_FAILURE, "malloc");
340 }
341
342 (*pfdp)[*nfd].fd = bl_getfd(bl);
343 (*pfdp)[*nfd].events = POLLIN;
344 (*blp)[*nfd] = bl;
345 *nfd += 1;
346}
347
348static void
349uniqueadd(struct conf ***listp, size_t *nlist, size_t *mlist, struct conf *c)
350{
351 struct conf **list = *listp;
352
353 if (c->c_name[0] == '\0')
354 return;
355 for (size_t i = 0; i < *nlist; i++) {
356 if (strcmp(list[i]->c_name, c->c_name) == 0)
357 return;
358 }
359 if (*nlist == *mlist) {
360 *mlist += 10;
361 void *p = realloc(*listp, *mlist * sizeof(*list));
362 if (p == NULL)
363 err(EXIT_FAILURE, "Can't allocate for rule list");
364 list = *listp = p;
365 }
366 list[(*nlist)++] = c;
367}
368
369static void
370rules_flush(void)
371{
372 struct conf **list;
373 size_t nlist, mlist;
374
375 list = NULL;
376 mlist = nlist = 0;
377 for (size_t i = 0; i < rconf.cs_n; i++)
378 uniqueadd(&list, &nlist, &mlist, &rconf.cs_c[i]);
379 for (size_t i = 0; i < lconf.cs_n; i++)
380 uniqueadd(&list, &nlist, &mlist, &lconf.cs_c[i]);
381
382 for (size_t i = 0; i < nlist; i++)
383 run_flush(list[i]);
384 free(list);
385}
386
387static void
388rules_restore(void)
389{
390 struct conf c;
391 struct dbinfo dbi;
392 unsigned int f;
393
394 for (f = 1; state_iterate(state, &c, &dbi, f) == 1; f = 0) {
395 if (dbi.id[0] == '\0')
396 continue;
397 (void)run_change("add", &c, dbi.id, sizeof(dbi.id));
398 }
399}
400
401int
402main(int argc, char *argv[])
403{
404 int c, tout, flags, flush, restore, ret;
405 const char *spath, **blsock;
406 size_t nblsock, maxblsock;
407
408 setprogname(argv[0]);
409
410 spath = NULL;
411 blsock = NULL;
412 maxblsock = nblsock = 0;
413 flush = 0;
414 restore = 0;
415 tout = 0;
416 flags = O_RDWR|O_EXCL|O_CLOEXEC;
417 while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "C:c:D:dfP:rR:s:t:v")) != -1) {
418 switch (c) {
419 case 'C':
420 controlprog = optarg;
421 break;
422 case 'c':
423 configfile = optarg;
424 break;
425 case 'D':
426 dbfile = optarg;
427 break;
428 case 'd':
429 debug++;
430 break;
431 case 'f':
432 flush++;
433 break;
434 case 'P':
435 spath = optarg;
436 break;
437 case 'R':
438 rulename = optarg;
439 break;
440 case 'r':
441 restore++;
442 break;
443 case 's':
444 if (nblsock >= maxblsock) {
445 maxblsock += 10;
446 void *p = realloc(blsock,
447 sizeof(*blsock) * maxblsock);
448 if (p == NULL)
449 err(EXIT_FAILURE,
450 "Can't allocate memory for %zu sockets",
451 maxblsock);
452 blsock = p;
453 }
454 blsock[nblsock++] = optarg;
455 break;
456 case 't':
457 tout = atoi(optarg) * 1000;
458 break;
459 case 'v':
460 vflag++;
461 break;
462 default:
463 usage(c);
464 }
465 }
466
467 argc -= optind;
468 if (argc)
469 usage(0);
470
471 signal(SIGHUP, sighup);
472 signal(SIGINT, sigdone);
473 signal(SIGQUIT, sigdone);
474 signal(SIGTERM, sigdone);
475 signal(SIGUSR1, sigusr1);
476 signal(SIGUSR2, sigusr2);
477
478 openlog(getprogname(), LOG_PID, LOG_DAEMON);
479
480 if (debug) {
481 lfun = dlog;
482 if (tout == 0)
483 tout = 5000;
484 } else {
485 if (tout == 0)
486 tout = 15000;
487 }
488
489 update_interfaces();
490 conf_parse(configfile);
491 if (flush) {
492 rules_flush();
493 if (!restore)
494 flags |= O_TRUNC;
495 }
496
497 struct pollfd *pfd = NULL;
498 bl_t *bl = NULL;
499 size_t nfd = 0;
500 size_t maxfd = 0;
501
502 for (size_t i = 0; i < nblsock; i++)
503 addfd(&pfd, &bl, &nfd, &maxfd, blsock[i]);
504 free(blsock);
505
506 if (spath) {
507 FILE *fp = fopen(spath, "r");
508 char *line;
509 if (fp == NULL)
510 err(EXIT_FAILURE, "Can't open `%s'", spath);
511 for (; (line = fparseln(fp, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0)) != NULL;
512 free(line))
513 addfd(&pfd, &bl, &nfd, &maxfd, line);
514 fclose(fp);
515 }
516 if (nfd == 0)
517 addfd(&pfd, &bl, &nfd, &maxfd, _PATH_BLSOCK);
518
519 state = state_open(dbfile, flags, 0600);
520 if (state == NULL)
521 state = state_open(dbfile, flags | O_CREAT, 0600);
522 if (state == NULL)
523 return EXIT_FAILURE;
524
525 if (restore) {
526 if (!flush)
527 rules_flush();
528 rules_restore();
529 }
530
531 if (!debug) {
532 if (daemon(0, 0) == -1)
533 err(EXIT_FAILURE, "daemon failed");
534 if (pidfile(NULL) == -1)
535 err(EXIT_FAILURE, "Can't create pidfile");
536 }
537
538 for (size_t t = 0; !done; t++) {
539 if (readconf) {
540 readconf = 0;
541 conf_parse(configfile);
542 }
543 ret = poll(pfd, (nfds_t)nfd, tout);
544 if (debug)
545 (*lfun)(LOG_DEBUG, "received %d from poll()", ret);
546 switch (ret) {
547 case -1:
548 if (errno == EINTR)
549 continue;
550 (*lfun)(LOG_ERR, "poll (%m)");
551 return EXIT_FAILURE;
552 case 0:
553 state_sync(state);
554 break;
555 default:
556 for (size_t i = 0; i < nfd; i++)
557 if (pfd[i].revents & POLLIN)
558 process(bl[i]);
559 }
560 if (t % 100 == 0)
561 state_sync(state);
562 if (t % 10000 == 0)
563 update_interfaces();
564 update();
565 }
566 state_close(state);
567 return 0;
568}
